sen.j: 真榊（まさかき）とは、神事の場で祭壇の左右に立てる祭具。
sen.e: Masakaki is a ceremonial implement that is placed on the both sides of an altar at Shinto rituals.

sen.j: 緑・黄・赤・白・青の五色絹の幟の先端に榊を立て、三種の神器を掛けたもの。
sen.e: A sakaki plant is placed on the head of five-color (green, yellow, red, white, blue) silk streamer and three sacred imperial treasures are hooked on.

sen.j: 五色絹の色は、陰陽五行説における天地万物を構成する5つの要素、木・火・土・金・水を表している。
sen.e: Five colors of silk streamer refers to five elements that compose the universe described in The Theory of Five Elements in Yin-Yang: wood, fire, earth, metal, and water.
